intro: Saussurea uryuensis, commonly known as the Japanese yomogi, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and yellow-orange flower heads. The plant produces small, composite flowers that are surrounded by bracts, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Saussurea uryuensis is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
